paragraphs.text: He does the strongest thing anyone can do, which is, he takes the violence and absorbs it. Not because he’s weak or passive, but because he understands that the greatest strength is that which absorbs all that pain, and when it does, it takes the pain, violence, and evil out of circulation.
paragraphs.name: 587d

paragraphs.text: This tradition starts with the divine who announces: it’s alllll gooood. Resurrection is the climactic announcement that it’s still good. And it’s worth being renewed, restored, and reconciled.
paragraphs.name: 874e

paragraphs.text: These Good Romans would look at them with frustration and ask, “Dude, what has your Jesus done besides getting his ass crucified? Caesar is creating a world of peace and prosperity, man. Get with it.”
paragraphs.name: cb11

paragraphs.text: From a historical context, can you see how punk rock this was? They were taking Roman military propaganda and subverting it for their own purposes.

This empire was run by a series of Caesars (yep, you’re probably way ahead of me, but I just found out it’s not just one guy). They believed that they were the sons of God who’d been sent to Earth to impart a universal reign of peace and prosperity.
paragraphs.name: fb0e

paragraphs.text: LMAO!
paragraphs.name: f844

8179583d1227.title: Amen. Happy Easter to you, and yours, Jonas.

paragraphs.text: Amen. Happy Easter to you, and yours, Jonas.

1359ca9eb3ca.title: My husband and I watched “Lincoln” last night.

paragraphs.text: My husband and I watched “Lincoln” last night. He took the violence out of circulation too. And it cost him. But even if he knew the end, as Jesus did, he would have gone through it all anyway, I’m guessing.
paragraphs.name: 1b97

99263c9ee4ab.title: I don’t know why I’m trying to begin a response to this.

paragraphs.text: I don’t know why I’m trying to begin a response to this. I’m speechless, totally blown away. Yup, I’ll read this again and again, and hope to retain some semblance of your piece and put to it to use in my life. You’ve said so much, too much for me to absorb all at once. Being a Christian seems relevant now after processing just the initial reading…
paragraphs.name: da6f

paragraphs.text: Totally!
paragraphs.name: a4ff

c08f6dd945be.title: “If you’re like me, you may have been told the story that Jesus died on the cross for your sins so…

paragraphs.text: “If you’re like me, you may have been told the story that Jesus died on the cross for your sins so that you could go to Heaven someday. It’s a lovely message…”
paragraphs.name: 8dd9

paragraphs.text: Well no, actually, it isn’t. It sounds fucked up in all sorts of ways, not least of which is the idea of Heaven. Be here, now! It’s glorious! It’s serene. Perfectly imperfect, it is what it is.
paragraphs.name: a0fd

paragraphs.text: Happy Easter to you too!

I have loved it. Very insightful. It is astonishing how the individualism of our western culture can turn even the purest act or intention into an ego-consumable axiom releasing us from all moral duty.
paragraphs.name: e8d1

paragraphs.text: I believe in everyday body and soul transformation. I am less worried about after death issues since we still have so much…

paragraphs.text: Oh Jonas, so well said. Wish I were as eloquent as you.This is the way I try to live my life, in small simple ways.And I wonder why history has taught mankind, or at least those with the power, absolutely nothing. I stop to remind myself who really is in control and then I feel better. Happy Easter to you, and thank you.
Insert John Waters here.
paragraphs.name: c4d4

paragraphs.text: There it is…

Like the soft stirring of a chill, crepuscular breeze that cheers on the sun as it clears the horizon and streams Light all over Creation, so now does my proto-Preacher give us all an inkling of his insight; of wisdom-bound, precognitive words that will change the world from the inside, and by one person, one…
